Its preservation, cultivation conditions and spore production were similar to that reported by García-Peña et al. (2001).Carbon source and mineral medium Pentane (Merck, 99%) was used as a model hydrophobic VOC. The mineral salt medium (MSM) used throughout the entire experimentation was prepared in a buffered phosphate solution (pH 4) and contained (g L−1): 18 NaNO3; 1.3 KH2PO4; 0.38 MgSO4·7H2O; 0.25 CaSO4·2H2O; 0.055 CaCl2; 0.015 FeSO4·7H2O; 0.012 MnSO4·H2O; 0.013 ZnSO4·7H2O; 0.0023 CuSO4·7H2O; 0.0015 CoCl2·6H2O; 0.0015H3BO3. The MSM was supplemented in all experiments with gentamicin (40 mg L−1) and chloramphenicol (50 mg L−1) to prevent bacterial growth and favor the fungal population (Arriaga and Revah, 2005). In this way, the study can be focused to the sole contribution of fungi to compound degradation.
